name: Video Voyeur #5: Reba McEntire Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: A man looking for love returns to a diner. While there he runs into a waitress who once told him never to give up looking for that one special someone. Which Reba video does this describe?
options: I Don't Need Nothing You Ain't Got
questions.explanation:
Somebody.

	Reba played a good luck charm in her 2005 video "Somebody". She was spotted in an elevator where a man and woman first met and then in a diner where a waitress and patron ran into each other twice. In the end, it looked as if love might have blossomed for the two couples Reba stood close to. "Somebody" was directed by Trey Fanjay and produced by Nina Grossman.

questions.text: Reba McEntire's very first music video told a story of a wife waiting for her husband to return from his business trip and possibly an on-going affair. What is the missing word in the title, "When Whoever's In New _______ Through With You"?
questions.explanation:
England's.

	"When Whoever's In New England's Through With You" was filmed in the city of Boston and Boston's Logan Airport in 1986. Reba's first music video was directed by John Small and Jeff Schock. In the final scene of the video, Reba's husband returns to her instead of going on his business trip.

questions.text: On her daughter's wedding day, a mother remembers the good times and bad times she shared with her daughter through the years. What is the name of this video?
questions.explanation:
I'll Be.

	The video for "I'll Be" was released in the year 2000. The video comes full circle when Reba, playing the adult daughter in the video, has to take care of her mother when she is older.

questions.text: Reba watches as a brother and sister are dropped off and picked up by their mother and father, respectively. What is the name of this video?
options: Love Will Find Its Way To You
questions.explanation:
Every Other Weekend.

	"Every Other Weekend" filmed at Los Angeles in 2008 starred Joanna Garcia and Steve Howey as the unnamed parents of the two children in the video. Both actors and Reba McEntire were formerly of the TV series "Reba". "Every Other Weekend" was produced by Randy Brewer and directed by Roman White. Kenny Chesney joined Reba for the duet, but was never seen in the video.

questions.text: Which of Reba's most controversial videos had a struggling wife and mother working as a waitress and attending college?
questions.explanation:
Is There Life Out There.

	"Is There Life Out There" was directed by Jack Cole and produced by Robin Beresford. Reba was criticized and praised for a video that held a strong message for working mothers everywhere. The video was awarded Academy of Country Music's Video of the Year in 1992.

questions.text: Reba performs at the Empire Ball Room during the year 1945 as a father returns home from the war. The song she sings is called "______ Kind of Love". What is the missing day of the week?
questions.explanation:
Sunday.

	"Sunday Kind of Love" was directed by Jack Cole and produced by Kitty Moon. The video was filmed in 1988.

questions.text: Does Reba's 1997 video "And Still" take place in Africa?
questions.explanation:
No.

	"And Still" took place somewhere in Central America as the opening line mentions. Reba's character meets her former flame and his new family while working in Central America. The video is directed by Jack Cole and produced by Sylvette Artinian.

Bruce Boxleitner.

	Bruce Boxleitner played the unnamed cowboy that everyone in the small town knew as Cathy's clown. The video was set in the Old West and was directed by John Small and produced by Narvel Blackstock in 1989.

questions.text: Which Reba video shows a famous singer and actress returning to her hometown to reminisce about how she got to where she is today?
questions.explanation:
Fancy.

	Reba took the song once performed by Bobbie Gentry in 1969 and made the song and video her own. The quote on the locket Fancy's mother gives to her before she dies is from Shakespeare's "Hamlet".

questions.text: The video for "The Night The Lights Went Out In Georgia" is about an elderly woman who admits killing her fiancé and sister-in-law.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Directed by Jack Cole and produced by Len Epand, "The Night The Lights Went Out In Georgia" is a full length music video that goes back in time forty years to the death of an innocent man. During the video, it is revealed that Reba McEntire's character killed her fiancé and sister-in-law while they were in bed together. Her brother took the blame for the murder and the judge sentenced him to death before the sister could come forward about the murder.
